intro: Psychotria megacarpa, commonly known as the giant psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans but serve as a food source for certain wildlife. Psychotria megacarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
